image_2.description: The chart displays the distribution of males and females across different age groups, ranging from 20-30 to 80-90, and is used to analyze the gender distribution in machine translation systems.
Represented by orange bars on the chart, indicating the percentage of males in each age group, and is part of the analysis of gender distribution in machine translation systems.
Represented by blue bars on the chart, indicating the percentage of females in each age group, and is part of the analysis of gender distribution in machine translation systems.

image_4.description: EN–FR systems refer to the English to French translation systems evaluated for gender-related performance issues, using 2K male-only and female-only test sets to assess system performance with respect to gender-related issues. The systems are trained on datasets that include gender tags to improve morphological agreement and word choices in translations.

NMT models refer to the neural machine translation models trained using the OpenNMT-py toolkit, which are sequence-to-sequence encoder-decoders with LSTMs as the recurrent unit. These models are trained with word-segmentation using BPE to reduce the out-of-vocabulary problem and improve translation quality.

BLEU scores are a metric used to evaluate the performance of NMT systems, including the gender-enhanced NMT systems. The scores for 10 baseline and 10 gender-enhanced NMT systems are presented in Table 2, and the BLEU-scores on EN–FR comparing the baseline and the tagged systems on 4 different test sets are presented in Table 3.
